programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Brouage, life in the marshes Just a few kilometres from Rochefort, the 11,000 hectares of the Brouage Marshes offer a landscape with a singular history, an area shaped both by the hand of man and by nature itself. With its wetlands providing fabulous reserves of biodiversity, the Brouage Marshes are also a haven for birds. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Toronto, Ontario
It's the season of babies! Louis' telephone hardly stops ringing... everyone thinks they have raccoons or squirrels in their walls or roof.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Quebec flavour for far away recipes The chefs Victor Soto, from the restaurant Tacos Victor, and Paul Toussaint, from the restaurant Kamùy, give recipes from other countries a distinctly Quebec twist. Fabien Cloutier and Johanne Despins have the pleasure of tasting these new culinary creations. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Cooking for zero waste
The peel and leaves from fruit and vegetables aren't just edible, they're delicious! Also on the programme: why you need to look after your microbiota and how to go about it. What to drink instead of coffee? And Moldovan pickled gherkins.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Centre J. Paul Getty, Los Angeles Avec ses allures de « village italien dans les collines », le Getty Center comprend des expositions de sculpture et d'art classique, de peintures européennes, de dessins, manuscrits, arts décoratifs et de photographies. Sa collection de chefs-d'oeuvre de grands peintres français, du Valentin à Moreau, tient une place d'honneur. Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Drôme The limestone plateaux of the Vercors, a naturally impregnable fortress; Mirmande, the gateway to Provence; La Garde-Adhémar and Tain-l'Hermitage: discover some of the most spectacular beauty spots of the Drôme. An unmissable artistic masterpiece, the Palais Idéal du Facteur Cheval welcomes the inquisitive to Hauterives for an enchanting visit. Directed by: Philippe Vergeot (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Haute-Vienne, a veritable treasure trail The Château de Châlucet is one of Nouvelle-Aquitaine's most important castles. Using augmented reality, an app enables visitors to see it in ages past. We also visit Grandmont Abbey, founded in the 11th century and the National Centre for Circus Arts, in the park adjoining the Château de Nexon. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Louis et la faune urbaine
programme.desc:
Picton, Ontario
Louis goes to Picton, in Ontario, to meet a client who is battling with a squirrel problem.
Presenter: Louis Larose.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: Breakfast for the "morning people" The chef Jean-Luc Boulay, from the restaurant Saint-Amour in Québec, offers the morning presenters, Patrick Masbourian, Ève-Marie Lortie and Kim Rusk, a real treat by preparing a meal that they had almost forgotten: breakfast. Presented by: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Ice lollies
Ice lollies, from 2002 to today. Gelato, paletas... and not forgetting the affogato that combines two Italian passions: coffee and ice cream, plus vegan ice creams!
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Choosing the right merguez sausage
If the merguez, a spicy sausage originally from North Africa, is made from lamb, sometimes from veal or from beef, in reality it's often made from beef and/or pork... Also on the programme: Isabelle Marquis analyses four new products, a plateful of weeds and all about cranberries.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: Maestro !
programme.desc: Falstaff Created at La Scala de Milan on 9 February 1893, "Falstaff" was the last opera composed by Giuseppe Verdi, to a libretto by Arrigo Boito and based on the works by William Shakespeare. With extracts from Dominique Pitoiset's production at the Opéra Bastille, Paris, in 2013. Presented by: Éric de Lochner. Directed by: Éric de Lochner (France, 2021)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Seine-et-Marne From François I to Napoleon, the town of Fontainebleau is marked by history and a must-visit for tourists; as is Provins, mediaeval walled-town and Unesco world heritage site. But the department also offers a host of delightful villages such as Barbizon and Moret-sur-Loing, so dear to Corot, Sisley and Millet. Directed by: Charlotte Marie (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Haute-Vienne, a veritable treasure trail The Château de Châlucet is one of Nouvelle-Aquitaine's most important castles. Using augmented reality, an app enables visitors to see it in ages past. We also visit Grandmont Abbey, founded in the 11th century and the National Centre for Circus Arts, in the park adjoining the Château de Nexon. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Une brique dans le ventre
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Épicerie fine
programme.desc:
The Pays Bigouden
In the Pays Bigouden, Brittany, Lenny and Lucie present all the stages involved in their seaweed production, from collection to sale. Sara explains the phases in brewing beer, from hops to tasting. To end, we meet some of the bird-lovers helping birds to nest.
Presented by: Guy Martin Directed by: Émilie Darnaud (France, 2022)

programme.title: La tête à l'endroit
programme.desc: America in Montbéliard! Montbéliard and the USA are two different lands yet closely links by the Franche-Comté origins of those who helped build America. In this special feature on the US in Montbéliard, the programme brings a touch of the New World to Doubs! Presenter: Guillaume Pierre.

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Present worldwide, Relais & Châteaux promotes the luxury hotel sector. Cooked upside down and eaten in situ: the Tatin pie, a mouthwatering mistake. The jewellery creator Annelise Michelson moves into design.. Wearing a tie. Akho: the brainchild of a designer launching an eco-responsible brand.
Commentary: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Papilles
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La belle vie
programme.desc: The free life of a vegan nomad Joëlle, a vegan nomad, took the decision to abandon city life for the peace and quiet of the Rockies. Discussing her life with Julien, she sets out all the advantages of living in the great outdoors, surrounded by breathtaking scenery. Presented by: Julien Roussin-Côté.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.desc:
Cooking for zero waste
The peel and leaves from fruit and vegetables aren't just edible, they're delicious! Also on the programme: why you need to look after your microbiota and how to go about it. What to drink instead of coffee? And Moldovan pickled gherkins.
Presented by: Johane Despins, Denis Gagné.

programme.title: La peinture française autour du monde
programme.desc: Musée de la Legion of Honor, San Francisco Le Legion of Honor de San Francisco est un musée d'art américain construit en 1924. Il rend hommage aux soldats Californiens morts en France pendant la Première Guerre mondiale et donne aux peintres, tels Claude Lorrain, La Tour, Le Sueur, Watteau, Boucher, Fragonard, Vigée Le Brun, une place de choix... Réalisation : Jacques Vichet (France, 2020)

programme.title: Les 100 lieux qu'il faut voir
programme.desc: Vosges From the Ballons des Vosges to Épinal, Gérardmer and Mirecourt, welcome to the Vosges, land of mountains, forests of conifers and crystal lakes! A department that invites you to travel back in time with a visit to Domrémy-la-Pucelle, Joan of Arc's birth-place, and to Grand with its famous Gallo-Roman site. Directed by: Gabrielle Dréan (season 2, France, 2015)

programme.title: Cap Sud-Ouest
programme.desc: Haute-Vienne, a veritable treasure trail The Château de Châlucet is one of Nouvelle-Aquitaine's most important castles. Using augmented reality, an app enables visitors to see it in ages past. We also visit Grandmont Abbey, founded in the 11th century and the National Centre for Circus Arts, in the park adjoining the Château de Nexon. Presented by: Éric Perrin.

programme.title: Paname
programme.desc:
Rue du Louvre
Measuring some 700 metres, the Rue du Louvre runs from the Rue de Rivoli to the Sentier district, crossing the 1st and 2nd arrondissements. Three of the street's best-known buildings have been given a complete facelift: the Bourse du Commerce, the Samaritaine and the legendary Poste Centrale.
Presented by: Yvan Hallouin.

programme.title: Ricardo
programme.desc:
Chicken lasagne
Classic lasagne with a new twist for this chicken lasagne recipe with cauliflower purée and creamy cheese sauce.
Presented by: Ricardo Larrivée.

programme.title: Littoral
programme.desc:
Yvonnick Jegat, defending natural oysters
In his "garden" in the Gulf of Morbihan, Yvonnick Jegat cultivates the art of the natural oyster. He uses only sea-born baby oysters, known as spat, that are then raised on the sandy seabed. Maison Jegat, founded in 1925, is a pioneer in the defence of traditional oyster farming.
Presented by: Marine Barnérias.

programme.title: Météo à la carte
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: L'épicerie
programme.sub-title: Séduire les employés... par le ventre
programme.desc:
The way to an employee's heart... through their stomach?
Does offering employees attractive meal options make good economic sense? Also on the programme: testing hand mixers; discovering ajvar, Balkan caviar; and a cake from Transylvania.
Presented by: Johane Despins.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Les fleurs qui racontent l'histoire de l'art de vivre français
programme.desc: Pas de description
